info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 03 at 6:41PM CDT until August 03 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN CLINTON...NORTHERN MARION AND SOUTHEASTERN FAYETTE COUNTIES... At 640 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near St. Elmo to Boulder, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe thunderstorms will remain over areas of northeastern Clinton, northern Marion and southeastern Fayette Counties, including the following locations: Alma...La Clede... Loogootee...St. James...Huey...St. Paul... Avena...Selmaville...Vernon and St. Peter. This also includes Carlyle Lake Recreational Area. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Illinois near exit 76. Interstate 57 in Illinois between exits 116 and 135. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
